unnormalised: ## Kachra Crisis: Let's Talk Waste Management, Yaar!
normalised: ## Kachra Crisis: Let's Talk Waste Management, Yaar!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever feel like we're drowning in... well, stuff? From plastic bottles overflowing from that roadside chai stall near Connaught Place to the sheer amount of paper piling up in our offices, waste management is a HUGE deal, especially here in India. We’re talking about our future, folks!
normalised: Hey everyone! Ever feel like we're drowning in... well, stuff? From plastic bottles overflowing from that roadside chai stall near Connaught Place to the sheer amount of paper piling up in our offices, waste management is a huge deal, especially here in India. We’re talking about our future, folks!

unnormalised: It’s not just about aesthetics (although, let’s be honest, cleaner streets are a definite plus!). Improper waste disposal contributes to pollution, impacts public health, and messes with our ecosystems. Remember that awful flood in Chennai back in December 2015? Blocked drainage systems clogged with plastic played a major role.
normalised: It’s not just about aesthetics (although, let’s be honest, cleaner streets are a definite plus!). Improper waste disposal contributes to pollution, impacts public health, and messes with our ecosystems. Remember that awful flood in Chennai back in December two thousand and fifteen? Blocked drainage systems clogged with plastic played a major role.

unnormalised: So, what can *we* do? Well, a lot actually! Think about the three Rs: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle. Simple things like carrying your own cloth bag when you go to the sabzi mandi (like my grandma, Kamala, always did!), saying no to single-use plastics, and composting kitchen waste can make a real difference. My friend, Rohan, started a composting initiative in his apartment complex in Bangalore on 26/01/2023, and the results have been amazing!

unnormalised: Recycling is another key piece of the puzzle. Check if your local municipality (like the MCGM in Mumbai) has a recycling program. If not, you can still separate your recyclables and find local kabadiwalas. They play a vital role in our informal recycling sector.

unnormalised: We also need to demand better waste management infrastructure from our governments. Look at the success stories like Indore, consistently ranked as one of India's cleanest cities. What are they doing right? Can we replicate those models in other cities like Kolkata and Patna?
normalised: We also need to demand better waste management infrastructure from our governments. Look at the success stories like Indore, consistently ranked as one of India's cleanest cities. What are they doing right? Can we replicate those models in other cities like Kolkata and Patna?

unnormalised: The Swachh Bharat Abhiyan is a great initiative, but it needs to be sustained effort. Let's not just clean up for that one photo op on 02/10/2014. Let's make it a lifestyle! And hey, if you’re a student at IIT Delhi or any other institution, why not explore innovative waste management technologies? Maybe you'll come up with the next big solution!

unnormalised: Let’s start small, one step at a time. Even segregating your waste for 15 minutes at 09:00 hrs on a Sunday morning can make a huge difference. Every effort counts! What are your thoughts? Share your waste management tips in the comments below!
